title: K-Star Equity and REO Asset Manager
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. REAL ESTATE CREDIT OVERVIEW
KKR Real Estate Credit was formed in January 2015 to invest in real estate credit products and complement KKR Real Estate’s private equity platforms. Within KKR Real Estate Credit, we seek opportunities where we have a sourcing, underwriting or execution advantage by leveraging KKR’s brand, industry knowledge and relationships. KKR Real Estate Credit currently invests through nine separately capitalized vehicles across our Direct Lending and Securitized Asset portfolios and consists of 50+ dedicated professionals based in New York, San Francisco, Houston and Dallas.
KKR has developed a dedicated services platform, K-Star Asset Management LLC (“K-Star”), to support asset management, loan origination, securities investing, risk management and client experience activities for its commercial real estate credit franchise as it continues to scale. The K-Star team includes industry specialists who oversee special servicing, portfolio analytics, underwriting, stabilized loan asset management, transitional loan asset management, real estate owned asset management, and investment oversight across KKR’s real estate credit portfolio.
POSITION OVERVIEW
K-Star is seeking an intelligent, analytical, and proactive Asset Manager with specialty experience in the management and disposition of Equity or REO assets. The Equity and REO Asset Manager will be responsible for the oversight and reporting on a portfolio of commercial and multi-family properties (“Properties”) on which control or title acquisition of the property, via foreclosure, deed-in-lieu, or receivership is imminent, and then for the management of the asset once Lender takes control. The Properties may be included in the direct lending portfolio or in the securitized asset portfolio, which consist of all property types located throughout the United States and will involve varying operating strategies and business plans. Adherence to KKR and K-Star policies and practices, along with the provisions of the governing servicing agreements and the Servicing Standard, will be required. The qualified candidate will also be expected to participate in special projects and assignments related to the growth of the platform. With a goal of optimizing investment performance, process development and execution for the portfolio of owned or lender controlled real estate, this candidate must be an exceptional communicator and have the ability to build strong partnerships across the various KKR businesses, including the Firm’s real estate credit and equity, securities investment, legal, finance, and asset management teams.
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Pre-foreclosure or Receivership

Advise on market and property condition during workout discussions in order to establish hold or disposition strategy
Understand financing and ownership structure and work with counsel and internal parties to establish appropriate timing and formation of any entity needed to hold title to the Property
Manage the activities of court-appointed Receivers as needed, including budgeting, leasing and property preservation, and recommendations for funding the Property’s cash needs


Asset Management

Execute on REO strategy by leading day-to-day efforts with brokers, property managers, joint venture partners, and other third party consultants
Liaise with joint venture partners, property management and accounting departments for review and acceptance of operating and capital budgets, monthly financial reporting, cash management, and lease administration
Work with third party partners to refine operating budgets and long-term development plans as appropriate, and understand and execute on capital improvement strategies for each Property
Analyze and utilize monthly and/or quarterly financial statements and rent rolls with comparison against underwriting and budgets
Lead regular calls with leasing team on pending new and renewal leases to ensure lease up strategy is being executed and monitor tenant credit risks
Support new lease term negotiations with market insight and analysis of comparable properties
Provide analysis and industry insights to support tax appeal efforts
Collaborate with construction consultants and other members of the project team to monitor schedules, budgets, and business plans in real time
Understand day-to-day property activities related to the zoning, feasibility, design and planning, permitting and approvals, construction, leasing, and disposition of ongoing and planned projects


Disposition

Identify and interview potential investment sales brokers based on the needs and the priorities for the Property;
Work with selected broker on due diligence, offering memorandum (OM) presentation and content, offer reviews, buyer selection, and purchase agreement negotiations
Negotiate other forms of disposition including receiver sales, auctions, and value-add joint ventures


Reporting

Prepare and present asset performance and portfolio reports to company management and other investor parties
Partner with internal and external legal counsel when evaluating legal issues and documenting various transactions arising from the asset management of the portfolio


Other

Lead special projects, including implementation of new technologies to support K-Star’s REO portfolio
Mentor portfolio analysts, junior asset managers and asset managers with on-the-job training and career development
Travel will be required



QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferably in a related course of study
Ten or more years of related work experience in equity and/or REO asset management of commercial real estate
Fundamental knowledge of commercial real estate, fixed income, and general financial concepts
Superior analytical and financial modeling skills
Excellent organizational, verbal, and communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail and thoroughness is required to ensure accuracy in all data and work product
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
CMBS Special Servicing, Argus, construction loan and development experience a plus
Team player with collaborative and strong relationship building skills and the ability to work independently in a way that reflects the company’s culture and core values
Skilled at developing and maintaining personal, social and business relationships representing KKR in a professional manner

 
 
 
 
#LI-OnsiteKKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
